apart.core.messages — Network Messages¶

This module provides classes to manage messages exchanged by nodes in the protocol.

The main class is LinkMsg, which models a link message. The enum classes MsgFlag and MsgInnerFlag respectively provides constant coding the types of link and end-to-end messages.

exception apart.core.messages.EndToEndDummyError[source]¶

Bases: Exception

Raised when a node is not able to produce an end-to-end dummy

class apart.core.messages.LinkMsg(sent_by, sent_to, c1, c2, flag, cid=None, rcid=None, seq_index=None, additional_info={})[source]¶

Bases: object

This is the main class of this module. It basically contains a header (an instance of LinkMsgHeader), two ciphertexts c1 and c2, the identities of the link-sender and the link-receiver, plus additional info for debugging and computing statistics.

static create_dummy(sent_by, sent_to, link_key=None)[source]¶

Convenience function providing a shortcut to create a link dummy message.

Parameters:
  • sent_by (int) – index of the link-sender node
  • sent_to (int) – index of the link-receiver node
  • link_key (any, optional) – not used in this implementation
Returns:

a dummy link message (with a dummy flag in its header)
Return type:

LinkMsg
additional_info¶

dict str->any – Adidtional information transported along with the message. For debug and measures purposes

c1¶

Ctxt – the first Elgamal ciphertext of the message

c2¶

Ctxt – the second Elgamal ciphertext of the message

cid¶

int – the cid value contained in the message header (see LinkMsgHeader.cid)

flag¶

MsgFlag – the flag contained in the message header (see LinkMsgHeader.flag)

header¶

LinkMsgHeader – the full message header

rcid¶

int – the rcid contained in the message header (see LinkMsgHeader.rcid)

sent_by¶

int – the index of the link-sender node

sent_to¶

int – the index of the link-receiver node

seq_index¶

int – the sequence index contained in the message header (see LinkMsgHeader.seq_index)

class apart.core.messages.LinkMsgHeader(flag, cid=None, rcid=None, seq_index=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

A link message header, containing at least a flag (type), and possibly, a cid, a rcid, and a sequence index.

Parameters:
  • flag (MsgFlag) – the flag of the message, specifying its type
  • cid (int, optional) – the circuit identifier value cid (Default: None)
  • rcid (int, optional) – the reverse circuit identifier value rcid (Default: None)
  • seq_index (int, optional) – the sequence index of the message, used in route proposals (Default: None)
cid¶

int – the circuit identifier.

This value can be None, for messages with flag MsgFlag.DUMMY

flag¶

MsgFlag – the flag specifying the type of the message

rcid¶

int – the reverse circuit identifier.

The only type of messages that should have a reverse circuit identifier are those with flags MsgFlag.RTPROP_RELAY_FWD and MsgFlag.RTPROP_RELAY_BWD. For other messages, this value is None.

seq_index¶

int – the sequence index of the message.

Sequence indexesUsed are used to differentiate the first and second message in a route proposal. Indeed, every step of the route proposals require two messages. Having this sequence index makes it easier to differentiate them.<

The only type of messages that should have a sequence index are those relating to route proposals. For other messages, this value is None.

class apart.core.messages.MsgFlag[source]¶

Bases: enum.IntEnum

An enumeration class giving the types of link messages in the network

DUMMY = 7¶

A dummy link message

PAYLOAD = 6¶

A regular payload message

RTPROP = 1¶

The first message in a route proposition

RTPROP_ANSWER = 2¶

Message sent by the proposee after receiving the RTPROP and RTPROP_INFO messages

RTPROP_FINAL = 3¶

Message sent by the proposer, that terminates the route proposal

RTPROP_RELAY_BWD = 5¶

The message to relay from receiver back to proposer in a relayed proposal

RTPROP_RELAY_FWD = 4¶

The message to relay from proposer to receiver in a relayed proposal

class apart.core.messages.MsgInnerFlag[source]¶

Bases: enum.IntEnum

An enumeration class giving the different flags an encapsulated message can have.

These flags usually go into the first ciphertext of the link messages), and are in particular used to signal end-to-end dummy messages and oriented communication messages

DUMMY = 1¶

A dummy en-to-end message

OCOM_CLOSE = 4¶

Indicates to the helper the closing of the session

OCOM_INIT = 2¶

A message part of the oriented communication initialization, exchanged between sender and helper

OCOM_RCV = 3¶

A message part of an oriented communication, for the end-receiver

class apart.core.messages.MsgInnerHeader(flag, ocomid=None, seq_index=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Inner header of a message of type MsgFlag.PAYLOAD.

An inner header contains data regarding the management of oriented communications and their initializations, and regarding end-to-end dummy messages

Parameters:
  • flag (MsgInnerFlag) – the inner flag, specifying whether the message is an end-to-end dummy, or one pertaining to an oriented communication
  • ocomid (int, optional) – the oriented communication identifier (Default: None)
  • seq_index (int, optional) – the sequence index of messages in an oriented communication (Default: None)
flag¶

MsgInnerFlag – the inner flag.

This flag specifies whether the message is an end-to-end dummy, or one pertaining to an oriented communication. In th elatter case, it also specifies which message it is as part of the initialisation of the communication.

ocomid¶

int – the oriented communication identifier.

Present in all payload and rtproprelay messages of oriented communications.

This value is None for end-to-end dummy messages (with inner flag MsgInnerFlag.DUMMY).

seq_index¶

int – the sequence index of messages in an oriented communication

This allows the actors of an oriented communication to know which message contains which information. Without this sequence index, the end-sender and indirectio nnode would not be able to run the oriented communicatio ninitlaisation properly.

This value is None for end-to-end dummy messages (with inner flag MsgInnerFlag.DUMMY).
